result.execSummary:
The defendant John J. Rohr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond of $100 applied.  Balance payable during probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment, including aftercare, if recommended.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant must obtain and maintain full-time employment/educational programming or a combination of both as recommended.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is not to enter into any pawn shops.  If Agent deems it appropriate, Defendant may apply to Drug and Alcohol Treatment Court and comply with the program if accepted.  Court orders expungement per Wisconsin Statute #973.015, upon successful completion of probation, all costs and restitution paid, and no further criminal violations for 5 years after today.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed - to be used by Agent with Court approval.
Credit is for revocation purposes.
To be completed within the first year.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
